column4: peanut, songbird would be the dominant program if they could work through the darn bugs
things that Ubuntu needs that it doesnt have . An easy to use desktop publishing program that doubles as web page making
like Publisher?
Adobe InDesign can make web pages, but you dont want to use it lol. I think desktop publishing and web page creation are seperate for good reason
but publisher is very good for basic web creation and basic desktop publishing. The openoffice people dont seem to understand that
not for making webpages I hope
sorry to hear that lol
i bet they validate real nice too.
who cares about validation. You look at the webpage in IE, firefox, safari, and opera if it looks fine its good enough
and that is why people shouldnt use frontpage lol
not just iPhone, people using assitive devices, web crawlers, etc
no, publisher is the problem, not the solution lol
if you use publisher you dont code a thing haha
thats just silly. lol two completely different animals
web pages arew dynamic, they are user interfaces and experiences. Print is static.
web pages dont need to be static. they arent just publications either. You can book plane ticket, buy stuff, download things, interact with people, etc
Most people need all that stuff on their webpage
that is silly. maybe in 1990 they didnt. Thats what the web has become.
i have never heard of printshop lol
learning web design with publisher is like... learning teaching drivers ed with a moped.
huh?
